item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, January 14, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. PostgreSQL Is the Database Management System of the Year 2024 (111 points | 25 comments)
2. I Switched to Firefox and Never Looked Back (170 points | 118 comments)
3. Snyk security researcher deploys malicious NPM packages targeting cursor.com (447 points | 211 comments)
4. Reversible Computing Escapes the Lab (21 points | 2 comments)
5. Carnarvon's NASA satellite dish receives first signal in almost 40 years (27 points | 5 comments)
6. In the Belly of the MrBeast (8 points | discuss)
7. Plant CO2 uptake rises by nearly one third in new global estimates (90 points | 68 comments)
8. Webtop – Alpine,Ubuntu,Fedora,and Arch containers containing full desktop envs (252 points | 47 comments)
9. I created an open-source Hardware Hacking Wiki – with tutorials for beginners (613 points | 89 comments)
10. The Plunge (2014) (146 points | 21 comments)
11. Debugging: Indispensable rules for finding even the most elusive problems (2004) (489 points | 206 comments)
12. FOSDEM and DMA updates and 2025 YH4F and Our visions for 2048 (8 points | discuss)
13. Lines of code that will beat A/B testing every time (2012) (332 points | 135 comments)
14. Fluid Simulation Pendant (391 points | 55 comments)
15. ZFS 2.3.0 released with ZFS raidz expansion (239 points | 158 comments)
16. Singapore is turning to AI to care for its rapidly aging population (21 points | 37 comments)
17. A secure distributed actor language (55 points | 18 comments)
18. How we used GPT-4o for image detection with 350 similar illustrations (175 points | 70 comments)
19. Voyage-code-3 (85 points | 23 comments)
20. Robinhood to Pay $45M SEC Settlement over Data Breach, Other Violations (13 points | 1 comment)
21. Dragonfly's extreme loop-the-loops (93 points | 34 comments)
22. Campsite is now open source (104 points | 66 comments)
23. A laptop stand made from a single sheet of recycled paper (314 points | 234 comments)
24. Can you complete the Oregon Trail if you wait at a river for 14272 years? (204 points | 97 comments)
25. Why is my CPU usage always 100%? (502 points | 137 comments)
26. Why Can't Programmers Be More Like Ants? Or a Lesson in Stigmergy (2015) (26 points | 17 comments)
27. New Glenn to make another launch attempt early Thursday (12 points | discuss)
28. What Is Treewidth? (17 points | 7 comments)
29. X-ray flashes from nearby supermassive black hole accelerate mysteriously (15 points | discuss)
30. FreeBSD Suspend/Resume (125 points | 57 comments)
